description: The ORDER_PROC table enables you to report on the procedures ordered in the clinical system. We have also included patient and contact identification information for each record.

columns.name: ORDER_PROC_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the order record associated with this procedure order.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL
columns.description: A unique, internal contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of the contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_CSN_ID
columns.description: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across patients and encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).

columns.name: RESULT_LAB_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the lab or other resulting agency, such as radiology, that provided the order results.

columns.name: RESULT_LAB_ID_LLB_NAME
columns.description: Interface laboratory name.

columns.name: ORDERING_DATE
columns.description: The date when the procedure order was placed.

columns.name: ORDER_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The order type category number for the procedure order.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Medications

columns.name: PROC_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the  procedure record corresponding to this order. This can be used to link to CLARITY_EAP.

columns.name: DESCRIPTION
columns.description: A brief summary of the procedure order.

columns.name: ORDER_CLASS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The order class category number of the procedure order.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Normal

columns.name: AUTHRZING_PROV_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the provider prescribing or authorizing the order.

columns.name: ABNORMAL_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether or not this order contains abnormal results. This column will contain a Y if there are abnormal results and an N or null if it does not. For orders with lab component results, if any one component of this order has an abnormal result value then this will hold a Y.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Abnormal


Normal

columns.name: BILLING_PROV_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the provider under whose name this order should be billed. This might be the same ID as the AUTHRZING_PROV_ID.

columns.name: ORD_CREATR_USER_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier of the user who signed the order, or the last person who performed a sign and hold or release action for a signed and held order.

columns.name: LAB_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number for the status of results for an order, as of the date and time the record was extracted.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


In process


Preliminary result


Final result


Edited


Edited Result - FINAL

columns.name: ORDER_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The order status category number of the procedure order.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Pending


Sent


Resulted


Canceled


Completed


Holding for Referral


Denied Approval


Suspend


Discontinued


Verified


Dispensed


Pending Verify

columns.name: MODIFIER1_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the modifier record.  This is the first modifier entered for the procedure and affects how the procedure is billed.

columns.name: MODIFIER1_ID_MODIFIER_NAME
columns.description: The name of the modifier record.

columns.name: MODIFIER2_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the modifier record.  This is the second modifier entered for the procedure and affects how the procedure is billed.

columns.name: MODIFIER2_ID_MODIFIER_NAME
columns.description: The name of the modifier record.

columns.name: MODIFIER3_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the modifier record.  This is the third modifier entered for the procedure and affects how the procedure is billed.

columns.name: MODIFIER3_ID_MODIFIER_NAME
columns.description: The name of the modifier record.

columns.name: MODIFIER4_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the modifier record.  This is the fourth modifier entered for the procedure and affects how the procedure is billed.

columns.name: MODIFIER4_ID_MODIFIER_NAME
columns.description: The name of the modifier record.

columns.name: QUANTITY
columns.description: The number of procedures authorized for this order.

columns.name: REASON_FOR_CANC_C_NAME
columns.description:
The reason for cancellation category number for the procedure order.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: FUTURE_OR_STAND
columns.description:
This column indicates whether an order is a future (F) or standing (S) order.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Standing


Future

columns.name: STANDING_EXP_DATE
columns.description: The date when a recurring procedure order expires.

columns.name: FUT_EXPECT_COMP_DT
columns.description: The date by which each future procedure order should be completed. Displayed in calendar format.

columns.name: STANDING_OCCURS
columns.description: The number of individual occurrences remaining for this procedure order.

columns.name: STAND_ORIG_OCCUR
columns.description: The total number of occurrences that a recurring order was authorized for.

columns.name: REFERRING_PROV_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the provider who has referred this order, i.e. the referring provider.

columns.name: REFERRING_PROV_ID_REFERRING_PROV_NAM
columns.description: The name of the referral source.

columns.name: REFD_TO_LOC_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the location record to which this patient was referred.

columns.name: REFD_TO_SPECLTY_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category value for the medical specialty of the provider to which the patient is referred.  This field does not contain data for referral orders created within Epic.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: REQUESTED_SPEC_C_NAME
columns.description:
The medical specialty category number of the provider to which the patient was referred for the procedure order.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: RFL_CLASS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The referral class category number for the procedure order.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Internal


Incoming


Outgoing

columns.name: RFL_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The referral type category number for the procedure order.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: RSN_FOR_RFL_C_NAME
columns.description:
The reason for referral category number for the procedure order.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: RFL_NUM_VIS
columns.description: The number of visits this referral order is authorized for.

columns.name: RFL_EXPIRE_DT
columns.description: The expiration date for this referral order.

columns.name: ABN_NOTE_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the notes record representing the Advanced Beneficiary Notice form associated with this order.

columns.name: RADIOLOGY_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID for the imaging study status (e.g. technician ended the exam, reading physician finalized the exam) of the procedure order.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Ordered


No Show


Scheduled


Arrived


Exam Begun


Procedure Started


Discontinued


Procedure Finished


Exam Ended


----- BEGIN READING PALETTE STATUSES -----


Tech Complete


Tech Revise


Resident Revise


Saved


Queued In Trans


In Transcription


Incomplete Transcription


Transcribed


Wet Read


Queued Prelim


Preliminary


Queued Needs Review


Needs Review


Revised


Queued Final


Final


Cadence Non-Imaging Order

columns.name: INT_STUDY_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID for denoting the reason a study is worth being marked for later review, as in for an educational case or for group reading physician review.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Teaching Case

columns.name: INT_STUDY_USER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the employee record who denoted a study as worth being marked for later review, as in for an educational case or for group reading physician review.

columns.name: TECHNOLOGIST_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the employee record of the technologist who performed this procedure.

columns.name: PROC_BGN_TIME
columns.description: The date and time when the procedure order (exam) is to begin.

columns.name: RIS_TRANS_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the user record of the transcriptionist for this order.

columns.name: ORDER_INST
columns.description: The instant when the order was created.

columns.name: DISPLAY_NAME
columns.description: The name of the order as it appears in the patient's record.

columns.name: HV_HOSPITALIST_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether or not this order was placed by a hospitalist. �Y�  indicates that this order was placed by a hospitalist. �N� or NULL indicate that this order was not placed by a hospitalist.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No

columns.name: ORDER_PRIORITY_C_NAME
columns.description:
The overall priority category number for the procedure order.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: CHRG_DROPPED_TIME
columns.description: The date and time when the charge was generated for the procedure order.

columns.name: PANEL_PROC_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the panel procedure record associated with this order.

columns.name: STAND_INTERVAL
columns.description: The time interval set for a recurring order, indicating the time between one instance of the order and the next instance.

columns.name: DISCRETE_INTERVAL_NAME
columns.description:
The discrete interval for the order.  This is extracted as the category title.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: INSTANTIATED_TIME
columns.description: The date and time of instantiation when a child order is generated from a standing or future order.

columns.name: INSTNTOR_USER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the user who instantiated the order.

columns.name: DEPT_REF_PROV_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the department to which this order is referred.

columns.name: SPECIALTY_DEP_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category value for the requested medical specialty of the department to which the patient is referred.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: REFD_TO_SPECLTY_C_NAME

columns.name: SPECIMEN_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The specimen type category number for the procedure order.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: SPECIMEN_SOURCE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The source category number for the procedure order.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: ORDER_TIME
columns.description: The date and time when the procedure order was placed.

columns.name: RESULT_TIME
columns.description: The most recent date and time when the procedure order was resulted.

columns.name: IS_PENDING_ORD_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether or not the order has a pending status. 'Y' indicates that the order has a pending status. 'N' or NULL indicates that the order does not have a pending status.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes

columns.name: PROC_START_TIME
columns.description: The date and time when the procedure order is to start.

columns.name: PROBLEM_LIST_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the problem list record that is associated with this order. This column is mainly used for immunization orders.

columns.name: RSLTS_INTERPRETER
columns.description: The name of the principal results interpreter, the person who reviewed and interpreted the results.

columns.name: PROC_ENDING_TIME
columns.description: The date and time when the procedure order is to end.

columns.name: SPECIFIED_FIRST_TM
columns.description: The first occurrence time specified by a user, if the order was signed with a frequency record containing a schedule of specified dates and times.

columns.name: SCHED_START_TM
columns.description: This column stores the scheduling start instant used when the order was last scheduled.

columns.name: SESSION_KEY
columns.description: The unique key associated with the order at the time of signing.  Other orders will share this key if they were signed at the same time.

columns.name: LABCORP_BILL_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The reference lab bill type category ID for the order record, indicating how reference labs should bill for services performed.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Client


Patient


Third-Party

columns.name: LABCORP_CLIENT_ID
columns.description: The client ID or account ID assigned by the reference lab.

columns.name: LABCORP_CONTROL_NUM
columns.description: Required information for LabCorp requisition and order messages.

columns.name: CHNG_ORDER_PROC_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the changed or reordered procedure order that this procedure replaced. This column is frequently used to link back to ORDER_PROC table.
